property.name: fs.default.name
property.description: The filesystem to work with -for monitoring, this must be an HDFS filesystem. This hostname in the URL must match the external hostname of the VM hosting the namenode.

property.name: service.monitor.portprobe.port
property.description: Port to probe via a telnet operation

property.name: service.monitor.portprobe.host
property.description: Port to probe via a telnet operation

property.name: service.monitor.pidprobe.enabled
property.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the Process ID Probe is enabled.

property.name: service.monitor.pidprobe.pidfile
property.description: The file containing the Process ID (PID) of the launched service.

property.name: service.monitor.report.classname
property.description: The class to use for reporting heartbeats

property.name: service.monitor.report.interval
property.description: Interval in milliseconds between reporting health status to the reporter

property.name: service.monitor.probe.interval
property.description: Time in millis between the last probe cycle ending and the new one beginning.

property.name: service.monitor.probe.timeout
property.description: How long in milliseconds does the probe loop have to be blocked before that is considered a liveness failure

property.name: service.monitor.bootstrap.timeout
property.description: The time in milliseconds for the monitor to wait for the service to bootstrap and become available before it reports a failure to the management infrastructure

property.name: service.monitor.portprobe.connect.timeout
property.description: Port probing key : timeout of the connection attempt

property.name: service.monitor.webprobe.connect.timeout
property.description: Timeout of the HTTP connection attempt

property.name: service.monitor.dependency.dfslive
property.description: Flag to indicate the monitored application depends on DFS going live before it starts -so the monitor should not worry about the application appearing not to bootstrap until then.
